svg.style: background: transparent; background-color: transparent; color-scheme: light dark;

as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-4" parent="1" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;verticalAlign=top;" value="Application" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="100" value="Platform" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="40" width="120" x="420" y="250" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-7" parent="1" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;verticalAlign=top;fillColor=#f5f5f5;fontColor=#333333;strokeColor=#666666;" value="Platform" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="70" width="100" x="190" y="270" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-16" edge="1" parent="1" source="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-8" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;exitX=1;exitY=1;exitDx=0;exitDy=0;entryX=0;entryY=0.5;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;endArrow=none;endFill=0;dashed=1;" target="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-11"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <Array as="points"> <mxPoint x="570" y="370" /> <mxPoint x="570" y="370" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-8" parent="1" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;labelPosition=center;verticalLabelPosition=middle;align=center;verticalAlign=top;fillColor=#e1d5e7;strokeColor=#9673a6;" value="Hardware" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="30" width="400" x="160" y="340" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-9" parent="1" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;verticalAlign=top;" value="Application" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="40" width="80" x="200" y="300" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-11" parent="1" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;fillColor=#fff2cc;strokeColor=#d6b656;" value="The <b>hardware</b> is the interface with the "real-world".<div><br></div><div>The hardware is the bridge to the real-world: E.g., interact with the user in an entertaining interaction (video games), playing back enteratinment controlling robotic equipment, evaluating real-world artifacts, showing sensor information, etc.</div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="170" width="200" x="600" y="300" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-17" edge="1" parent="1" source="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-13" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;exitX=1;exitY=0.5;exitDx=0;exitDy=0;entryX=0.5;entryY=0;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;" target="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-14"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-13" parent="1" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;fillColor=#fff2cc;strokeColor=#d6b656;" value="<b>Application</b>: Code deciding which side-effects shall be triggered." vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="50" width="200" x="600" y="100" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-18" edge="1" parent="1" source="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-14" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;exitX=0.5;exitY=1;exitDx=0;exitDy=0;entryX=1;entryY=0.5;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;" target="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-11"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-14" parent="1" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;fillColor=#fff2cc;strokeColor=#d6b656;" value="<b>Side-effects</b>: changing state or accesing information from the "real-world"." vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="60" width="190" x="840" y="220" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-15" parent="1" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;labelPosition=center;verticalLabelPosition=middle;align=center;verticalAlign=top;fillColor=#FFCCFF;strokeColor=#9673a6;" value="Real-world" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="30" width="400" x="160" y="370" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-19" parent="1" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;fillColor=#fff2cc;strokeColor=#d6b656;" value="<b>Platform</b>: Providing abstractions of other Application code for Application code.<div><br></div><div>E.g., to provide an easier interface, or support various different Platforms and/or hardware.</div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="110" width="200" x="600" y="170" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-20" parent="1" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;fillColor=#fff2cc;strokeColor=#d6b656;" value="<b>Software</b>&nbsp;<b>architecture</b> can become arbitrarily complex: many Application and Platform layers nowadays sit on top of each other until the hardware is triggered.<div><br></div><div>Make sure to keep Application and Platform code separate, and make the boundary interfaces visible.</div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="140" width="200" x="260" y="420" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-22" parent="1" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;fillColor=#fff2cc;strokeColor=#d6b656;" value="The Application code uses either a Platform or directly triggers hardware." vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="60" width="130" x="414" y="180" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="pKw6BrBKKRu-paiUkLYO-23" parent="1" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;fillColor=#fff2cc;strokeColor=#d6b656;" value="Platforms can exist that do not trigger any side-effects." vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="50" width="110" x="425" y="280" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> </root> </mxGraphModel> </diagram> </mxfile>

rect.style: fill: light-dark(rgb(213, 232, 212), rgb(31, 47, 30)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(130, 179, 102), rgb(68, 110, 44));

div.div:
The hardware is the interface with the "real-world".
The hardware is the bridge to the real-world: E.g., interact with the user in an entertaining interaction (video games), playing back enteratinment controlling robotic equipment, evaluating real-world artifacts, showing sensor information, etc.

switch.text: The hardware is the interface wit...

div.div: Application: Code deciding which side-effects shall be triggered.

div.div: Side-effects: changing state or accesing information from the "real-world".

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 398px; height: 1px; padding-top: 277px; margin-left: 1px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center; color: #000000;

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 198px; height: 1px; padding-top: 125px; margin-left: 441px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Platform: Providing abstractions of other Application code for Application code.
E.g., to provide an easier interface, or support various different Platforms and/or hardware.

rect.style: fill: light-dark(rgb(255, 242, 204), rgb(40, 29, 0)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(214, 182, 86), rgb(109, 81, 0));

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 198px; height: 1px; padding-top: 390px; margin-left: 101px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Software architecture can become arbitrarily complex: many Application and Platform layers nowadays sit on top of each other until the hardware is triggered.
Make sure to keep Application and Platform code separate, and make the boundary interfaces visible.

rect.style: fill: light-dark(rgb(255, 242, 204), rgb(40, 29, 0)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(214, 182, 86), rgb(109, 81, 0));

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 128px; height: 1px; padding-top: 110px; margin-left: 255px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: The Application code uses either a Platform or directly triggers hardware.

rect.style: fill: light-dark(rgb(255, 242, 204), rgb(40, 29, 0)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(214, 182, 86), rgb(109, 81, 0));

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 108px; height: 1px; padding-top: 205px; margin-left: 266px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: Platforms can exist that do not trigger any side-effects.

a.text: Text is not SVG - cannot display
